text: Unpretentious looking 12 oz. bottle pours a clear golden/yellow color with small tight white head and a little lacing. Aroma is full of hay, barley malt and cereal. Taste is slightly sweet with hops coming out in the finish to leave a bitter aftertaste. Body is light but not watery, with a crisp mouthfeel and without too much carbonation. This is easily drinkable and refreshing. I savored the first one and found it to be one of the most flavorful lagers Ive ever tried. If I had blind tested it, I would have guessed it was brewed in Germany. It is also as humble and understated as the typical Minnesotan, who would rate it "not too bad". Ill be sure to bring home more of these on my next trip to Mankato.

Pours a clear pale yellow color with white head. Cereal grains, wheat, hay, and a light grass on the nose; follows onto the palate. Light bodied. Finishes with a light cereal grain sweetness, but mostly clean.
12 oz bottle clear yellow pour fast fading white head no lacing, medium carbonation, good beer for the style.
Bottle. Creamy barley malt and hay aroma. Pale yellow with large white head. Mildly sweet creamy barley malt and mildly bitter hay flavor. Nice body. Very good.
B+. Pours a hazy yellow color with white head. Would like a little more flavor, but refreshing
Clear gold lager. Rich, bready malt flavor, amd.good palate. Good carbonation. They nailed this style, even if the styl e doesnt does not lend itself to variety.

Bottle:
Very light, slightly hazed yellow-gold with a small bright white head.
Barley, grain malt aroma.
Sweet barley malt, a hint of baked bread, honey flavour.
Really nice .

A rare beer that tastes like you remember your first surreptitiously acquired lager from decades ago. Aroma released from a stylish pour to three fingers of foam is part corner bakery, part grassy field after the thresher has gone through. Taste has a sweet start and mildly bitter and dry finish. Will definitely bring home more on next trip west.

12oz bottle a slightly hazy golden with a medium white head. Sweet grain malt aroma, light grassy hop. Taste is of very sweet malt, yeast, light hop and bitterness in finish. A tad too sweet but drinkable.
Draft at Sioux Falls fest. Clear pale yellow color. Aroma of white pepper. Taste is plain lager.
not too bad. kind of a malty, slightly grainy sweet, with a little help from corn/rice. Bodys not bad. drinkable beer.
